Posts.Content: Sep 17, 2011 06:46PM mclvig wrote: I'm going to go to UCSF and hopefully get into their I Spy 2 clinical trial.  At first in Stockton my Dr. thought I had a 2cm tumor with 3 satelite spots and when I went to University California San Francisco at the Carol Frank Buck Canter Center with a Dr who does this all the time she felt it was one larger 3-3.5 cm. They are going to do neoadjuvant chemo first, which will reduce the tumor and then surgery.  This is the scariest thing in my life. The waiting of not knowing is enough to give a person a heart attack.  I find that I have to take a 1/2 of xanax to get to sleep at night. Don't laugh at the 1/2 dose, I don't handle drugs well.  HAHA wonder what chemo will feel like when all I can tolerate is a 1/2 dose of xanax. Anyway thanks for your posts.
